elements.question: The atomic number of an atom is the number of ______ in the atom's nucleus.
The rows in Periodic Table are called __________.
Which one of the following elements is very rare?
How many periods and groups are present in the periodic table?
Which of the following forms the basis of the modern periodic table?
What happens to the electropositive character of elements on moving from left to right in a periodic table?
What is the other name for group 18th elements?
Which of the following elements has 2 shells and both are completely filled?
Which of the following statements are TRUE?

answers.a: The first 94 elements in Periodic Table occur naturally
answers.b: Elements 95 to 118 have only been synthesized in laboratories or nuclear reactors
answers.c: Alkali Metals occupy the left-most column of the Periodic Table

elements.question: Who proposed Law of Triads?
Which of the following represents the general electronic configuration of an element belonging to the p-block of the periodic table?
What happens to the size of atoms of elements of p-block as we move from left to right in the same period?
What is the maximum covalency of the nitrogen atom?
Why does nitrogen show poor tendency towards catenation?

answers.a: N atom can form multiple pπ – pπ bonds
answers.b: Octet of N2 is complete unlike carbon
answers.c: The N ≡ N is unreactive at room temperature
answers.d: The N – N single bond is weaker and unstable

elements.question: What is the primary product of  Haber-Bosch process?
Which gas is released when copper chips are subjected to concentrated nitric acid?
What shape is the HNO3 molecule in its gaseous state?
Which of the following ions is the brown ring test useful for determining?
What catalyst is used for oxidation of ammonia to produce nitric acid?
What is the oxidation state of nitrogen in di-nitrogen trioxide?
